column4: hi guys. I'm looking for a tool for hardy to make a live usb, but can't find any packages in synaptic. Can someone point me to the live usb creator deb or something?
why not use intrepid to do this?
because I want to install Intrepid from usb stick
I don't want to wast a CD
i thought you said hardy, do you want hardy or intrepid on the flash drive?
i want to create intrepid live usb on hardy
i see.  i don't know of a .deb that does that in hardy, but if you upgrade (via the internet) you can then create the bootable flash drive you desire (to install on subsequent machines).
yeah i want a clean install since i have a seperate home partition anyway
agreed... i prefer a clean install, too.
do you have another networked machine with 2 or more network cards installed?
nope
you've already downloaded the cd iso file?
yes
again i don't know of a .deb that will do it, but there were some instructions on pendrivelinux.org for an older version of ubuntu.  the procedure should be the same.
hm ok. Kinda stupid frankly that they don't provide a backport, since it's a pretty common usecase I'd imagine
sorry, that should have been pendrivelinux.com
it's a new feature of a new version of ubuntu.  a backport may take some time.
i can see why that is, but still. It'd make more sense to push it to hardy before intrepid since that's where people upgrade from
perhaps you could suggest it to the developers (without calling them stupid).
heh didn't mean to imply anything here :)   Actually UNetbootin seems to do what i need
cool, UNetbootin... huh?  I'll have to take a look.
